author: Fuseworks Media
title: First Summer at the Bowl concert announced
text:
Fuseworks Media Monday, 5 October, 2015 - 11:55 
The popular mix of opera and comedy is returning to New Plymouth as part of the Summer at the Bowl programme! 
Sol3 Mio is the first concert of the programme to be announced for the TSB Bowl of Brooklands, as part of the group’s On Another Note album tour. 
The larger than life tenor brothers Pene and Amitai Pati and their baritone cousin Moses Mackay performed at the picturesque venue last year and won over a crowd of thousands with their cheeky humour, charming personalities and of course their powerful operatic voices. 
They are returning to perform for their Taranaki fans in what will be another memorable night at the Bowl on Saturday 5 March 2016. Fans can look forward to music from their new album along with their favourite classics at the upcoming concert. 
Venues Manager Nelita Byrne says: "We are thrilled to announce the first summer concert at our wonderful TSB Bowl of Brooklands. I’m sure there will be many fans who will be very excited to see Sol3 Mio back here to perform." 
Summer at the Bowl has a great line-up of events that cater to a range of tastes and budgets. Taranaki’s Christmas will kick off with Christmas at the Bowl, the favourite family event, on Sunday 20 December 2015. Tropfest, the short film competition and festival, will be held on Saturday 27 February 2016; and WOMAD, the festival that brings music, culture and food from countries spanning the globe to New Plymouth, is on from Friday 18 to Sunday 20 March 2016. 
With such a diverse line-up of events over summer, there’s something for everyone at the TSB Bowl of Brooklands. Get together with your friends and family and enjoy! 
Tickets for Sol3 Mio are on sale to the general public from noon on Friday 9 October at the TSB Showplace ticket office or online at ticketmaster.co.nz.
